result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic A Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:06 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Dominic A Berry in court, in custody, with Attorney Samantha J. Humes. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; MAY BE SERVED IN PRISON SYSTEM; to commence consecutive to any sentence in being 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $268 + $250 DNA Surcharge = $518; to be reduced to civil judgment
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given
Recess: 3:40 pm

case called at 9:05am. 
Defendant Dominic A Berry appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Samantha Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Humes stipulates that the videoconferencing connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Humes indicates that Mr. Berry is prepared to accept the State's plea off; he no longer wishes to await the outcome of the revocation proceedings.
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
recess 9:06am.  

NEXT:  Plea/Sentencing hearing tomorrow at 3:00pm.
Status conference on November 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

[Clerk; MK]
case called at 8:34am. 
Defendant Dominic A Berry in court, in custody, with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer R.J. Wagner -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Humes
Officer B. Sachse--sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Humes

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Berry committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
recess 9:00am.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/15/14 at 3:00pm (2) schedule Status Conference approximately two weeks after the Pretrial date
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice
[MK]

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:40pm.
Defendant Dominic A. Berry appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (Mr. Berry still qualifies for PD and Attorney Humes remains as appointed PD counsel). 
Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court summarizing the history of the case.
The Court considers the Warrant to be satisfied; the Warrant should be removed from any database. 
Attorney De La Rosa provides a new address for Mr. Berry:  1917 Medera Street, #4 in Waukesha WI 53189

The Court requires a $750 cash bond, with the same conditions as previously ordered:
-No contact with Cody Alexander, Kevin Zimmerman, Heidi Green, Kelly Price, Loren Gerrits, Michael Geneman, Sarah Hazebrouck, or Julie Dahms
-No presence at 700 North High Street in Fort Atkinson, Shopko in Fort Atkinson, Festival Foods in Fort Atkinson, Pick N Save in Fort Atkinson, or Walmart in Jefferson
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
Recess: 2:18 pm

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 9/22/14 at 8:30am.  (Mr. Berry is currently on a DOC in the Jefferson County Jail)

case called at 9:46am. 
Attorney Samantha J. Humes in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Humes indicates that she spoke with Mr. Berry's agent this morning and learned that there is an issue with Mr. Berry's absence from the halfway house since yesterday. 
The deputy in the courtroom indicates there is now a warrant pending for Mr. Berry. 
The Court issues a bench warrant for Mr. Berry- body only. 
ADA Hall indicates that the State's plea offer is "suspended" pending further information. 
recess 9:49am.

[KG]
Case called at 1:46 pm.  

Defendant Dominic A. Berry in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
Defendant informs the Court that he does not have a current address.
Defendant informs the Court that his mail can be delivered to in C/O Jefferson County Jail.
Court informs Mr. Berry upon release he is to notify C.O.C. of his current address within 48 hours of learning of said address.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the maximum penalties recited should increase from 12.5 years to 18.5 years because of a prior felony conviction.
Court verifies with Mr. Berry that he understands the maximun penalties recited.

Court requires $250 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Cody Alexander, Kevin Zimmerman, Heidi Green, Kelly Price, Loren Gerrits, Michael Geneman, Sarah Hazebrouck, or Julie Dahms
-No presence at 700 North High Street in Fort Atkinson, Shopko in Fort Atkinson, Festival Foods in Fort Atkinson, Pick N Save in Fort Atkinson, or Walmart in Jefferson

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. 

The Court further orders under Wis. Stat. 940.47, a no contact with Julie Dahms except through an attorney.

Recess: 2:18 pm

NEXT: 
PTC and Status- To be scheduled
